wikipedia_page.main: David Richard Thomas or Archdeacon D H Thomas  (1833 – 11 October 1916) was a Welsh clergyman and historian.  He was a canon of St Asaph's Cathedral and Archdeacon of Montgomery, as well as being a Fellow of the Society of Antiquaries of London.  His major publication was the History of the Diocese of St Asaph, the first such history of a Welsh diocese.
